definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: After the first instance verdict, Lin appealed to the Nanjing intermediate court.
sentences.chinese: 一審判決後，林某不服上訴至南京市中級法院。

sentences.english: Ultimately, the court verdict, Hwang jailed for 11 years.
sentences.chinese: 最終，經法院一審判決，黃某獲刑11年。

sentences.english: The Court of Appeal has confirmed the judge’s decision.
sentences.chinese: 上訴法院維持了一審法官的判決。

sentences.english: Zhang Leyi thinks in petition for appeal, court of first instance adjudicates misgivings.
sentences.chinese: 張樂奕在上訴狀中認爲，一審法院判決不妥。

sentences.english: Now, the case heads back to a superior court, where a trial could take years.
sentences.chinese: 目前，該案回到上級法院，一審可能需要幾年時間。

sentences.english: This will be an ongoing partnership if the first trial week is successful.
sentences.chinese: 這將是一個長期合作關係，如果一審周是成功的。

sentences.english: Dispute occurred when actor Zhu Shimao and another man found a company and Zhu won in the first instance.
sentences.chinese: 共同創辦公司出資起糾紛演員朱時茂一審勝訴。

sentences.english: Jiang has lodged appeal against the sentence.
sentences.chinese: 一審判決後，姜人傑提出了上訴。

sentences.english: The first trial lasted three weeks, and the jury deliberated for another week.
sentences.chinese: 一審持續了三週，陪審團又討論了一個星期。

sentences.english: It is possible for a Lord Justice to sit alone at first instance.
sentences.chinese: 上訴法院法官也可以獨任審判一審案件。
